Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, with faint traces of nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393208) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393208)
